text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
OmhDataPoint
header 1..1BackboneElement
dataPointId 1..1id
creationDateTime 1..1instant
schemaId 1..1BackboneElement
namespace 1..1uri
name 1..1string
version 1..1string
acquisitionProvenance 0..1BackboneElement
sourceName 1..1string
sourceDataPointId 0..1string
sourceCreationDateTime 0..1instant
modicationDataTime 0..1instant
modality 0..1code
userId 0..1string
body 1..1OMHStepCount

Documentation for this format

name: OMHDataPoint
description: Open mHealth data point schema represents a data point.  See  [Open mHealth Schemas](http://www.openmhealth.org/documentation/#/schema-docs/schema-library).

element.definition: The data point schema is a generic schema that is specialized for each type of data point.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: The header property contains the metadata about the data point.
The identifier of this data point. We strongly recommend this to be a globally unique value.
The date time this data point was created on the system where data is stored.
The version of the schema, e.g. 1.0.

mapping.comment: maps to canonical for FHIR profile

element.definition: The namespace of the schema. A namespace serves to disambiguate schemas with conflicting names.
The name of the schema.
The version of the schema, e.g. 1.0.
The data point provenance information.
The name of the source of the data.

mapping.comment: Can also use the Provenance resurce

element.definition: The identifier of this data point at the source (immediately preceding step).
The date time (timestamp) of data creation at the source.
The date time (timestamp) of last data modification at the source.
The modality whereby the measure is obtained.
The user this data point belongs to.  This is an opaque identifier.

mapping.comment: references  represented with an identifier (logical reference)

element.definition: The body property contains the actual data.  It contains the logical model for a specific data type. ( e.g., heart rate).

mapping.comment: See the FHIR Logical Model for any OMH data point type (e.g., steps)

element.definition: The data point schema is a generic schema that is specialized for each type of data point.
The header property contains the metadata about the data point.
The identifier of this data point. We strongly recommend this to be a globally unique value.
The date time this data point was created on the system where data is stored.
The version of the schema, e.g. 1.0.

mapping.comment: maps to canonical for FHIR profile

The version of the schema, e.g. 1.0.
The data point provenance information.
The name of the source of the data.

mapping.comment: Can also use the Provenance resurce
